originalText.text: As a student since Feb '23, this is one of the best atmospheres I've worked in to learn the art of Wing Chun Kung Fu. Sifu William Kwok is an incredible role model to both practice with and learn from. Love the PWC family!

text.text: As a student since Feb '23, this is one of the best atmospheres I've worked in to learn the art of Wing Chun Kung Fu. Sifu William Kwok is an incredible role model to both practice with and learn from. Love the PWC family!

originalText.text: This school is an amazing martial arts school. The martial arts being taught, Wan Kam Leung Practical Wing Chun, is a very practical martial arts with great depth. The students there are all very nice and welcoming. The instructor, Sifu William Kwok, is very attentive to details. I have been practicing this amazing martial arts for 3 years and it was a really rewarding journey.

text.text: This school is an amazing martial arts school. The martial arts being taught, Wan Kam Leung Practical Wing Chun, is a very practical martial arts with great depth. The students there are all very nice and welcoming. The instructor, Sifu William Kwok, is very attentive to details. I have been practicing this amazing martial arts for 3 years and it was a really rewarding journey.

originalText.text: Wan Kam Leung Practical Wing Chun is a modern martial arts school located on Manhattan's upper east side (E. 61st Street). The school was founded and is operated by Master William Kwok (Kwok Wai Yin), a highly skilled, attentive, patient and knowledgable martial artist and human being. Kwok Sifu is a direct student of GM Wan Kam Leung of Hong Kong. I have been a member of the school for about 8 years and feel myself very fortunate indeed to have found it. It is a fabulous place to learn Kung Fu, to develop your mind and body, experience a bit of Chinese culture, met new people and make new friends, and learn how the lessons of Kung Fu translate to life. It is located in the heart of one of the most vibrant cities in the world. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, steeped in traditional martial art culture, and yet quite modern in its philosophy and approach. The school is open 6 days/week, visitors are welcome (call first for current pandemic related rules), accepts students of all ages, no prior martial arts experience is required, offers a trial lesson, and has an amazing group of students, instructors, and disciples who are happy to share their knowledge with you. If you are in town, or in the neighborhood, I highly recommend a visit. I love this place!! You will too.

originalText.text: I was in New York for a few days because my wife had a work conference so I decided to pay Sifu William Kwok a visit at his school. I was immediately welcomed with open arms to join in on a couple of classes, with payment of course. As an instructor visiting another school I was treated with the utmost respect by Sifu Kwok and his students. The training atmosphere and environment was very good and his students were very skillful. The school is clean, tidy and classes were very organized. I would recommend 100% anyone looking to learn Kungfu to join the school there!

originalText.text: Practicing Wing Chun at Gotham Martial Arts has been one of the most rewarding experiences in my life. Master Kwok is an attentive instructor with an eye for detail whose teachings are not limited to combat. I've become a more focused, goal oriented individual under his tutelage.  Joining the school has been a positive experience and I've lost more than 50 lbs participating in class for the last two years. I highly recommend this program to anyone who is interested in a practical system for self defense.
